intro: Capsella foliosa, commonly known as the leafy mouse-ear or leafy catchfly, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lobed, succulent leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Capsella foliosa is a short-lived perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters.
